column2: 3. When drivers come to this sign, they must:
column4: be ready to stop at the stop sign.
column6: stop doing what they are doing.
column8: brake sharply and come to a complete stop.
column10: warn other drivers that a stop sign is ahead.

column2: 5. Which shape is a warning sign?

column10: Keep right, traffic is entering from another road.

column4: tells drivers that the minimum safe speed is 45 MPH.
column6: shows the current speed limit that all vehicles traveling in the direction of the arrow must not exceed.
column8: provides advance notice to upcoming speed limit change.
column10: indicates the suggested highest safe speed.

column4: means that you need to stop.
column6: is a Construction and Maintenance Traffic Control sign.
column8: is displayed on the rear of slow moving vehicles.
column10: is found at most intersections and indicates that drivers must yield to other vehicles.

column4: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
no turns are allowed on this road.
column8: the road may be slippery when wet.

column2: 17. Which shape is a stop sign?
18. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: yield to trucks coming from the hill on the right.
column6: be ready to shift to lower gear.
column8: be ready to brake sharply and stop.

column4: Slow down and give vehicles crossing your path the right-of-way.
column6: Drive with caution in wet weather.
column8: You must come to a complete stop.
column10: The traffic light will soon be red.

column2: 21. What is the only effective method to reduce your BAC?
column4: Not drinking over a period of time.
column6: Eating before or while you drink.

column2: 22. What can you do to prevent skids on snow and ice?
column4: Allow the wheels to keep turning.
column6: Decrease pressure on the brake pedal if your wheels begin to lock.

column2: 23. _________________ your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes.
column4: It is not recommended to check

column2: 24. When children are close, what should you do before you back out of a driveway?
column4: Look through your back window for children.
column6: Get out of the car and check behind the car.

column2: 25. You ________ traffic headed toward you when you turn left.

column4: keep less space in front of their vehicle.
column8: try to pass them as they have different braking capabilities than other motor vehicles.
column10: keep more space in front of their vehicle.

column4: the condition of your brakes and tires.
column6: the speed your vehicle is traveling.

column2: 28. Which of the following does NOT affect the distance that it takes to stop your vehicle?
29. If another car has stopped in an adjacent lane in the same direction of travel, you should:
column4: be careful in case the other vehicle has stopped for a pedestrian.
column6: pass the car on the left.
column8: speed up and pass the vehicle on the right.
column10: tap your horn to let the other driver know you are passing.

column2: 30. Drivers are permitted to turn right on a red traffic signal:
column6: when they have stopped and checked to see that the turn will not interfere with crossing traffic.
column8: when signs clearly indicate that a right turn on red is permitted.
column10: after first slowing and verifying the turn will interfere with other traffic and pedestrians.

column2: 31. When driving near light rail vehicles, drivers should:
column4: expect trains on any track at any time.
column6: never drive around lowered crossing gates.
column8: always obey signs and traffic signals.

column2: 32. What should you do if one of your tires blows out?
column4: Hold the steering wheel tight and slowly take your foot off the gas pedal.
column6: Hold the steering wheel tight and brake immediately to avoid the risk of skidding.
column8: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other vehicles.

column4: yelling, honking, gesturing at other drivers.
column10: quick lane changes without a signal.

column2: 34. To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should:
column6: Allow enough travel time to reach your destination on schedule.
column8: Adjust your schedule to drive during times with the most highway traffic.

column2: 35. Keeping a space cushion between you and the other vehicles around you is important because it:
column6: keeps traffic flowing at a safe pace.
column8: gives you time to react to situations.

column4: The same as a STOP sign.
column6: Go, but yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.
column10: The light will soon change to steady red.

column2: 37. Does a vehicle prepared to enter a traffic circle or rotary have right-of-way over vehicles in the circle?
column6: No. Vehicles already in the circle have the right-of-way.
column8: Only if the light is green.
column10: Yes, but only if they are entering the rotary from the right lane.

column2: 38. A driver cuts off another vehicle, or threatens another motorist or a pedestrian. These are examples of:

column6: sound your horn to alert the other drivers.

column2: 40. When driving in heavy traffic, you should:
column4: drive with the flow of traffic.
column6: drive slower than the flow of traffic.
column10: drive faster than the flow of traffic.
